chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Xavier Morales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with the victim P.O.S. with dob 6/25/2002 or the victim's family without prior Court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.
Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.
No firearms, weapons.

Sex offender assessment.  Follow through with recommended programming.
Cognitive intervention programming.
Agent to have access to all the defendant's electronic devices.
Keep agent apprized of the make, model and plate of vehicles.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Pay DNA surcahrge,  all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
Costs/fees, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment  and/or  tax intercept or other means.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Xavier Morales

records.addlTxt:
Per Remittitur dated July 9, 2019, Appeal No. 2018AP000020, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on May 29, 2019, that: 
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21 (2017-18).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Marcella De Peters is relieved of any further representation of Robert Xavier Morales on appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32 (3) (2017-18).

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Xavier Morales in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Robert Xavier Morales in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court addressed statements the defendant made in the PSI interview.  Defendant stated in the PSI that he did not commit the crime and no longer wishes to retain counsel.  After having colluquy with the defendant, defendant states the he committed the act.  Court finds no cause to withdraw counsel.

Statements made as to sentencing. 
AMENDED COUNT 1 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 18 YEARS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 8 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim, POS, with DOB 6/25/2002, or the victim's family without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.
* Agent to have access to all the defendant's electronic devices.
* Keep agent apprized of the make,  model and plate of vehicles.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Robert Xavier Morales in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Robert Xavier Morales in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Amended information, received and filed, amending COUNT 1 to 2ND DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT OF CHILD, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.02(2), a Class C felony.

Copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, momentarily pleads not guilty.

AMENDED CHARGE:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements of the Offense/Jury instruction received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the factual basis to sustain the plea are placed on the record by defense counsel .  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Xavier Morales in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Robert Xavier Morales in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

OTHER ACTS MOTION:  Court tentatively ruled in favor of State's motion.  Court will issue limiting instructions and allow State to argue propensity and defense can counter with a expert. Defendant Robert Xavier Morales in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  
Defendant Robert Xavier Morales in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
